> it struck me why not have a self assertive code

This is what came to mind when I read the original post.  There are, of
course, arguments both for and against both sides.

For JUnit: any form of testing is better than none (as well as many
others).
Against JUnit: test cases are in a different class (even if it is in an
inner class [*]) than the test subject.

The only solution that I can see would be to make testing (or assertion)
an integral part of the language (ala Eiffel).  This would mean that
tests (assertions) would be an integral part of a method definition.

For now, I'll stick with JUnit.

---
*.-  As I believe was pointed out in a previous post, inner class tests
may be just as unlikely to be updated than purpose built test classes

Manuel Amago.
